metadata.synopsis: Hope will stop players to warn them about the prison ahead, and that they need to have Orphic Hammer to help her
metadata.how_to_trigger: 1. CTY_Main_A2. Get to the triggerteleport S_LOW_HouseOfHope_HopeSpirit05Trigger

38.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
38.text: Careful. The jailor will swallow you whole if you take another step.
38.context: NodeContext: quietly, warning in hushed tones

3.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
3.text: AND YOU WON'T BE ABLE TO SAVE ME WHILE YOU'RE BEING DIGESTED

44.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
44.text: You found my prison. My body is held in chains just beyond.
44.context: NodeContext: composing herself after outburst on previous node, calmly explaining the situation

57.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
57.text: BUT YOUR MEAT IS COOKED YOUR SOUL IS SCORCHED AND YOUR RACE IS RUN
57.context: NodeContext: happy outburst, enjoying the patterns of the language despite the dire news they contain

0.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
0.text: RAPHAEL IS STRIDING ACROSS THE PLANES CHASING THE BEAT OF YOUR TERRIFIED HEART
0.context: NodeContext: dramatic, enjoying the intensity of the situation despite its dangers

31.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
31.text: He still has your contract. And while he does, you have approximately zero ways of surviving an encounter with him.
31.context: NodeContext: composing herself and trying to make this sound less dire than it is

52.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
52.text: You'll have to find it, lickety-split, right after you free me.
52.context: NodeContext: cheerful despite the dire situation

17.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
17.text: And you have precisely zero ways of breaking me out of my chains.
17.context: NodeContext: cheerful despite the dire situation

34.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
34.text: DID YOU EXPECT TO BREAK THEM WITH YOUR THICK SKULL?
34.context: NodeContext: panicked outburst, incredulous at player's stupidity

54.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
54.text: BUT WHERE IS YOUR CONTRACT YOU INGLORIOUS LUMP
54.context: NodeContext: outburst, insulting the player but only because she's frustrated

4.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
4.text: Presumably, you intend to chew through the chains, cracking your teeth like eggshells.
4.context: NodeContext: not sarcastic - she genuinely believes this is what the player plans to do, ludicrous as it is

22.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
22.text: It won't work! The Hammer is the only thing capable of shattering the chains.
22.context: NodeContext: first phrase is urgent, then she calms a little to deliver the info

23.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
23.text: NOT HERE YOU WON'T YOU BLUNDERING CRICKET

58.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
58.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst and delivering a clear instruction, calmly

65.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
65.text: When you remove it, the whole House will go up in flames.

78.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
78.text: Yes it is. And when you remove it, the whole House will go up in flames.

73.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
73.text: And Raphael will fly home furious.
73.context: NodeContext: mostly calm, but with a hint of dread. She's very scared of Raphael

68.speaker: Player
68.text: Why can't I just free you now?

42.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
42.text: The sound of the chains breaking will echo across the planes - Raphael will fly home furious when he hears it.
42.context: NodeContext: mostly calm, but with a hint of dread. She's very scared of Raphael

32.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
32.text: If he still has your contract when that happens, you're dead as dung.

74.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
74.text: READY FOR RAPHAEL'S HOMECOMING? HA! HE'LL USE YOU AS A HANDKERCHIEF
74.context: NodeContext: Quzizical and incredulous on first phrase (you can't possibly be ready for this, are you mad?). Forced, single 'ha'. Then the last phrase is a terrifying prospect

47.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
47.text: No, no, no, don't listen to me. You're going to do just fine. I'll be waiting.
47.context: NodeContext: composing herself and trying to be reassuring while clearly panicking

9.speaker: Player
9.text: This all sounds like more trouble than it's worth.

12.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
12.text: THEN RUN RUN RUN AS FAST AS YOU CAN

46.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
46.text: I'll still be here, hoping you change your mind.

53.speaker: Player
53.text: Freeing you is more trouble than it's worth.

29.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
29.text: Maybe that's why nobody has. I hoped you were different.

72.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
72.text: You really went and did it, didn't you?

55.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
55.text: The whole House is tumbling down, and Raphael's striding across the planes to come catch a mouse.
55.context: NodeContext: in awe of the incredibly dangerous situation she and the player are in

76.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
76.text: Now swing that big, beautiful Hammer, crack open my chains, and let's get out of here.

51.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
51.text: IT'S TIME TO FLY THIS COOP ON A HOPE AND A PRAYER
51.context: NodeContext: outburst of relief and joy

60.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
60.text: YOU SOUND SO BRAVE BUT WE REALLY DON'T HAVE A CHOICE

79.speaker: Player
79.text: Any advice when it comes to fighting Raphael?

8.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
8.text: But if you must, make sure I'm with you. He makes mistakes when he's angry, and seeing me running free will make him as angry as an axe-head.
8.context: NodeContext: composing herself and trying to

20.speaker: Player
20.text: I'm getting out of here without you.

10.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
10.context: NodeContext: flat, not enough energy to be emotional

56.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
56.text: I hope you manage to escape regardless. Goodbye, goodbye, goodbye, goodbye.
56.context: NodeContext: encouraging but sad, expecting this to be her final goodbye

36.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
36.text: I was rather hoping I'd be leaving with you rather than sizzling like a frog in a furnace.
36.context: NodeContext: sad, resigned to her fate

26.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
26.text: BUT DO YOU EXPECT TO SHATTER THE CHAINS WITH YOUR THICK SKULL?

43.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
43.text: Sorry, sorry, sorry. I'm sure your skull is lovely. I can't wait to see it. WITH ALL THE SKIN ATTACHED OF COURSE.
43.context: NodeContext: composing herself after an outburst and trying to placate the player. On final phrase she's afraid she's accidentally threatened them and is clarifying manically.

49.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
49.text: But you didn't bring the Hammer. It's the only thing that can break my chains.

1.speaker: Player
1.text: I have no idea where it is.

69.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
69.text: MY HEART IS SINKING LIKE A STORM-TOSSED SHIP

19.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
19.text: I don't think the Hammer is even on this plane of existence. That is quite a quandary.
19.context: NodeContext: composing herself as she sounds out the sheer impossibility of the situation

45.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
45.text: I TOLD YOU HOW IMPORTANT IT IS AT LEAST A MILLION TIMES

13.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
13.text: Retrace your steps all the way back to the cradle and your mother's womb if you have to. FIND THE HAMMER.
13.context: NodeContext: composing herself to try and give clear instructions that become increasingly deranged

63.speaker: GROUP_Act3_LOW_HouseOfHope_Hope
63.text: You had it when you arrived, so go and find it.
63.context: NodeContext: composing herself to try and give clear instructions

5.speaker: Player
5.text: I will bring the Hammer. And we will be ready for Raphael.
